title: BTC Explorer does not utilize ElectrumX to see transactions
body:
Version: 1.88

When using the BTC Explorer functionality, and searching for a known address, the transactions are not being displayed.  I have the Electrum Server functionality enabled, running, and synced.

I found that if I change line 27 of ```/usr/share/mynode/btc_rpc_explorer_env``` from:

```BTCEXP_ELECTRUMX_SERVERS=tls://127.0.0.1:50002```

...to...

```BTCEXP_ELECTRUMX_SERVERS=tcp://127.0.0.1:50002```

...and then: ```sudo systemctl restart btc_rpc_explorer```, the transactions are displayed correctly.  I don't know if this is the correct fix or not, but it works for me locally.

Can do a pull request if it is helpful.

body:

```
It appears a recent upgrade may not have fully completed.
```

title: Can't restore wallet from encrypted seed
body:
When trying to create wallet with seed (the seed is password protected) i get the response:
Error Creating Wallet!

It works fine for restoring wallets with no PW that have been created in mynode.

title: Feature requests: Blocksat & Veracrypt
body:
I would like to try myNode, but the main thing stopping me is that I use my current pi node to run Blocksat.  I would love if I could run Blocksat on myNode and get all the additional functionality, Dojo, etc vs my current set up.  And having Blocksat available adds a huge extra level of badassery to myNode!
[https://github.com/Blockstream/satellite#running-on-raspberry-pi](url)

I also like having VeraCrypt handy on devices to store any sensitive crypto files.  Would be another sweet addition.
[https://github.com/veracrypt/VeraCrypt](url)

What is the base OS myNode runs on?  Would it happen to be Ubuntu Mate?  If so it's trivially easy to compile Blocksat and Veracrypt on it, and I could do it myself.  If it's a different distro, perhaps the devs could look into adding these features?

Thanks

title: VPN Doesn't Work (RPi4)
body:
VPN was in a constant state of "Setting Up..." (All night long.)

I looked in the logs and found:

```
Jan 22 21:56:06 myNode ovpn-server[19670]: failed to find GID for group openvpn
Jan 22 21:56:06 myNode ovpn-server[19670]: Exiting due to fatal error
```

I did:

```
sudo groupadd openvpn
sudo useradd openvpn -g openvpn
```

This fixed previous error, but now most recent `/var/log/openvpn.log` shows VPN still is not working:

body:

My version is 0.1.74

Do you have any advice?
Thanks

Special thanks to BTCxZelko for getting me started with Dojo and assisting with the code. 
Special thanks to Amiga500 for helping with testing.

title: Enable all CPU Cores in Bitcoin when Quicksync Off
body: If a user disables quicksync, it would help if myNode automatically changed bitcoind.conf line par=-1 to par=0 (or remove it for the default par=0).  This gives a **noticeable performance boost during the initial block download (IBD)**.  Setting par=-1 as it is now, means to leave one CPU core unused, and that CPU core is doing nothing until the IBD completes. -1 makes sense after block download, to leave an extra CPU core for Lightning and other processes, so you can set it back to -1 after Bitcoin is synced. But it shouldn't make much difference to just leave it as 0, as Bitcoin doesn't use much CPU after IBD.

title: HTTPS doesn't stick
body: When logging out it, it takes you back to the non-HTTPS login page, so if you log back in you are back on HTTP. Logging out from HTTPS  should go to the HTTPS version of login page.

title: One Click Upgrade Not Working
body: Still not working for me since the first time I did it after installing MyNode Premium on Christmas. Just tried again, .76 to .79, rebooted, web page said Upgrading, did this for about 10 minutes, took me back to login screen, still on .76. When I do the manual upgrade process, everything works as expected. I have provided logs to help email address before, but my node will not one click upgrade since .74 or whatever version was release on 12/25.

title: myNode failed to find public IP
body:
It's been working pretty seamlessly. Did the latest update to 0.1.75 version and two days ago I noticed the message "failed to find public IP" in the Settings area. I hit the refresh button and it was immediately resolved. Today I got the same message but the refresh button is not helping.

I noticed while trying to learn how to open a lightning channel and realized the lightning wallets were giving a "waiting" message.
Thanks
John

title: Uppercase I vs lowercase l vs #1
body:
Would propose a different font.
Something so we can easily differentiate between uppercase I (i) vs lowercase l (L) and the number 1.

Currently, mistakes are easily made as I & l look alike. 

A font that would work extremely well: 
Solway

i (i) - I (i) - l (L) - L (L) - 1 looks like this in Solway:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/43671869/70053350-8c0b7580-15d5-11ea-83f3-476377de4139.png)

Currently Arial and Helvetica are default and i (i) - I (i) - l (L) - L (L) - 1 looks like this:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/43671869/70053537-eefd0c80-15d5-11ea-9caa-aa8d0bc0db78.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/43671869/70053578-04723680-15d6-11ea-91d2-e867941ddf4b.png)

...

Netdata                x | y

What do you think about? it would be more easily to handle it.. and very useful for rPi3 ...

title: Write Guide on using Blue Wallet via Tor
Write Guide describing Open Ports + Uses
Write Guide for Accessing GUI via Tor
Write Guide for Wasabi + myNode
FEATURE: Add UI for local mini-screen (connected to raspi)
FEATURE: Customize BTC RPC Explorer to match myNode UI feel
Thoughts about the current UI
body:
:fist_oncoming: 

First, congratulations on the project. I think it is very important for this ecosystem create more alternatives for each individual to have their own node.

I would like to open this thread to think about the possible improvements that I think the project should have regarding UI / UX.

I think it would be very important to get away from the *ServerSideRendering* pattern and build something API oriented. In this way we could create a better and most UI/UX friendly frontend client. Also In this way we could create a good security policies for our API and give other developers the opportunity to create / improve different clients.

Imagine a client with:
 - push notifications (tx states, invoices...)
 - auto (hidden) updates...
 - great mobile UX

Thoughts??

title: Improve initial setup UX
body:
1. Show all stages (completed, current, next) during setup, quicksync, reboot, etc
2. Option to show verbose details
3. Option to interrupt the process

title: Minor UI improvements
body:
- [x] don't show other QS options when it's disabled
- [ ] example commands on bitcoin-cli page
- [ ] temperature on remote login

title: Tor failure leading to failing bitcoin and/or lightning
body: Sometimes resetting Tor from the settings page solves the issue.

It could be a good idea to add this feature on settings?
